articles.headline: Tom Brady wins inaugural Fanatics Games, $1M prize
articles.description: Tom Brady emerged Sunday as the winner of the inaugural Fanatics Games, which pitted athletes and celebrities against fans in eight competitions this weekend at Fanatics Fest in New York.

images.name: Tom Brady declares LeBron the GOAT of the NBA
images.caption: Tom Brady shouts out LeBron James on "The Shop Live," calling him basketball's greatest of all time.

articles.headline: Pennsylvania governor to work with Eagles, Steelers on stadium needs
articles.description: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro declined to get into specifics about funding for any new sports arenas -- a possibility with the Eagles' lease set to expire in 2032.

articles.headline: Jayden Daniels card sells for $500,000 to Commanders' Josh Harris
articles.description: Jayden Daniels rookie card sells for $500,000 at Fanatics Fest 2025.

articles.headline: Fred Smith, ex-Washington NFL team part-owner, FedEx founder, dies
articles.description: Fred Smith, a former minority owner of the Washington NFL franchise and the founder of FedEx Corp., a prominent sponsor across the landscape of sports, has died.

images.name: Fred Smith (June 22, 2025) [1296x729]
images.caption: Fred Smith, seen here supporting his son Arthur Smith before a Falcons game in 2021, has died. The FedEx Corp. founder was 80.

articles.headline: How flag football has revived Chuba Hubbard's Olympic dreams
articles.description: Hubbard set aside his Olympic track goals to reach the NFL, but flag football has revived his chances of competing on the international stage.

images.name: Chuba 1 [608x342]
images.caption: Sticking to his Canadian roots, Panthers running back Chuba Hubbard attended Game 2 of the Stanley Cup Final in Edmonton.

images.name: Chuba Hubbard [608x342]
images.caption: Chuba Hubbard rushed for a career-high 1,195 yards and 10 touchdowns for the Carolina Panthers in 2025.

articles.headline: Mavericks' Sean Sweeney joins Spurs as associate head coach
articles.description: Mavericks assistant Sean Sweeney has agreed to a deal to become the associate head coach of the San Antonio Spurs under Mitch Johnson.

articles.headline: Mickey Moniak's 3-run homer helps MLB-worst Rockies avoid sweep with 4-2 win over D-backs
articles.description: — Mickey Moniak hit a three-run homer to cap a four-run fifth inning, Antonio Senzatala won his second straight start, and the major league-worst Colorado Rockies snapped a three-game skid...

articles.headline: Brewers pound 17 hits to complete 3-game sweep of Twins with 9-8 win
articles.description: — Rhys Hoskins homered, doubled and drove in two runs on Sunday as the Milwaukee Brewers completed a three-game sweep of the Minnesota Twins with a 9-8 victory.

images.name: Byron Buxton ties it with solo homer for Twins
images.caption: Byron Buxton evens the score at 1-1 with a solo home run to left.

articles.headline: Blue Jays' Max Scherzer (thumb) expected to start Wednesday
articles.description: Three-time Cy Young Award winner Max Scherzer is expected to be activated from the 60-day injured list to start for the Toronto Blue Jays at Cleveland on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Donovan Solano hits 2 homers as the Seattle Mariners beat the Chicago Cubs 14-6
articles.description: — Donovan Solano homered twice and drove in five runs, helping the Seattle Mariners outslug the Chicago Cubs for a 14-6 victory on Sunday.

articles.headline: Vargas has tiebreaking hit in 8th inning as White Sox rally to beat Blue Jays 4-2
articles.description: — Miguel Vargas hit a tiebreaking double in the eighth inning and the Chicago White Sox rallied to beat the Toronto Blue Jays 4-2 on Sunday.

games.name: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers

articles.headline: Drier than last year's parade, proud Panthers party at beach
articles.description: Much drier than last year's rain-soaked celebration, the Florida Panthers celebrated their second straight Stanley Cup title Sunday afternoon with a parade and rally on Fort Lauderdale Beach, with captain Aleksander Barkov telling fans "this is amazing."

images.name: Panthers beat Oilers in 6 games to claim 2nd straight Stanley Cup
images.caption: Sam Reinhart's four goals are the catalyst for the Panthers as they take down the Oilers in Game 6 to win another Stanley Cup.

articles.headline: Blackhawks acquire Andre Burakovsky from Kraken for Joe Veleno
articles.description: The Blackhawks have acquired Andre Burakovsky from the Kraken in exchange for fellow forward Joe Veleno.

images.name: Andre Burakovsky tallies goal vs. Sharks
images.caption: Andre Burakovsky tallies goal vs. Sharks

articles.headline: Panthers' Brad Marchand's eventful run with Stanley Cup
articles.description: The Florida Panthers' Stanley Cup win caused for an eventful wave of celebration from the center.

images.name: Brad Marchand [608x342]
images.caption: Brad Marchand and the Stanley Cup crowd-surfed through E11EVEN in Miami.

images.name: Panthers GM tells McAfee how the team was built
images.caption: Panthers GM Bill Zito tells Pat McAfee about Florida's path to back-to-back Stanley Cups.

articles.headline: Stars ink D Nils Lundkvist, F Mavrik Bourque to 1-year deals
articles.description: The Stars re-signed defenseman Nils Lundkvist and forward Mavrik Bourque to one-year contracts on Friday.

articles.headline: Stanley Cup Final ratings drop from '24, lower than 4 Nations
articles.description: U.S. television ratings for the Stanley Cup Final rematch between the Panthers and Oilers declined from their first matchup a year ago and rated lower than February's 4 Nations Face-Off, which saw Canada defeat the U.S. in overtime.

articles.headline: PWHL Seattle names Steve O'Rourke as team's first coach
articles.description: Steve O'Rourke has been named coach of the PWHL Seattle expansion team.
